result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J Herman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge 
Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance
Abuse Program. Court grants sentence credit of 4 days.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Defendant is not to possess any firearms. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Anger Manaagement counseling to be determined by agent. Court waives DNA surcharge and specimen. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Count 1

miscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Dept. Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Firearms previously confiscated are ordered to be destroyed. Defendant is not to possess any firearms.
Court waives DNA surcharge and specimen. See Count 1 for additional conditions.

on defendant's motion for release pending appeal

THIS BOND IS SPECIFICALLY FOR RELEASE PENDING APPEAL.  IF DEFENDANT IS UNABLE TO POST, HE IS  TO CONTINUE SERVING THE CONDITION TIME IMPOSED ON MAY 18, 2015.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.
John H. appeared by phone.

Defendant Justin J Herman in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. John H. appeared by phone.  Case called for defendant's motion for release pending appeal.  Defense objects to John H. appearing at this hearing.  Court overrules objection.  Arguments by the Defense.  Arguments by the State.  Court grants defendant's motion the defendants Motion for Release Pending Appeal with the condition that the defendant is to post $1,250.00 cash bail prior to release from Huber.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  All other conditions to remain as previously ordered.  If the defendant is unable to post cash, he is to continue serving his condition time as ordered by the Court on May 18, 2015.  Defendant to remain on Probation.  Defense requests Judgment of Conviction be amended to specifically include release for child care.  Clerk will contact the Huber authorities and amend the JOC if necessary to ensure the intent of the court to have release for all standard release conditions including child care is being followed.
Motion hearing on June 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Release Pending Appeal.

Defendant Justin J Herman in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Arguments by the Defense.  Statement by B.B.  Statment by defendant.  If defendant requires surgery while on Condition time he should notify the court of the dates.

Court orders the following:

Count 1:
- Total sentence: 3 years 6 months (Initial Confinement: 1 year 6 months, Extended Supervision: 2 years) STAYED
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation. 
- Cash bail to be refunded to poster.
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:   Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Defendant is not to possess any firearms.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Anger Management counseling to be determined by Agent.

Count 2:
- Total sentence: 4 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years) CONSECUTIVE to Count 1. STAYED
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Restitution of $150.00 to be paid to the Waukesha Police Department as a Condition of Probation
- Firearms previously confiscated are ordered to be destroyed.
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1.
CONDITION TIME: 9 months - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence May 19, 2015 by 5:00 pm.
